runs.comm: full and swinging away away, Smith doesn't move his feet but pushes it to cover
gets it on a length around off and Smith just pushes it softly towards mid-on for a quick single
really full and swinging from the leg stump line, squares up the batsman who pushes it down to mid-on for another single
oh that is cracked away of the back foot! He arches back and slaps it over point with a lot of power.. There wasn't much room on that at all
and make it two boundaries now as Southee strays in line and delivers a poor delivery on the pads.. Smith flicks it fine and beats the man at short fine leg easily
back of length on off, Smith defends this solidly down the pitch
full and angled away from the batsman, Simmons chases it and is lucky not to edge it.. Ronchi takes it low in front of him
short of length this time, the batsman lets it go through
another one going away from the right-hander.. Simmons is staying back, not very sure about when this is going to suddenly veer into him, lets it go through
charges down the pitch and looks to send it to one of the stands, but gets a thick bottom edge to short fine leg
he is keeping him guessing.. another one goes away from the batsman, beating the outside edge as Lendl keeps his bat close to his body
make is six in six, good pace, good carry and leaving the right-hander again. Lendl leaves it alone. Superb start for Boult

Smith falls! Early end again. he bowls this one with a scrambled seam and gets it to dart into the batsman.. Smith didn't expect that. It hits his thigh and rattles the stumps. It did grip the surface there
fuller delivery first up and the batsman gets off the mark with an inside edge to midwicket
it looked like it was heading to the sight screen, but it barely makes to the edge of the circle. Simmons charges and looks to flat-bat over the bowler, but only gets a toe-end to that
fuller delivery on the stumps, the batsman pushes it to mid-on
he shuffles across and whips the full length delivery to deep midwicket for a single
no movement of the feet but Simmons drives it down to long-off to keep the strike
still no sign of the inward movement, Simmons chops it in front of square for a single to cover
he gets a touch square up as even he expects it to come in, but it doesn't. The batsman pushes it to point
beautifully bowled, quite nippy too. The batsman leaves it alone
he pushes this one softly to mid-off to call for a quick single
makes room and moves way down the leg side, then looks to power it over the infield but can only chop it to the keeper. he is lucky that it doesn't take his leg stump along
this is better, he leans forward and pushes the length delivery to cover
starts off with a leg-side loosener, flicked down to fine leg easily for a boundary
full and aimed on the stumps, the batsman digs it out to mid-on for a single
hello! Here comes the big one! He gives no warning, just launches into this slower length delivery and sends it flying over deep midwicket for the first six
he responds with a yorker on the offstump, the batsman digs it out somehow
now some width, but he fails to take advantage as he hits it straight to point.. Could have been in trouble has Baz hit the stumps.. Yeah, he was miles out..
goes for his preferred fuller length, the batsman pushes it to long on for a single
gives the batsman some width but Fletcher can only push it as far as cover, calls for a quick single
this has sailed for a six! Behind backward point.. Simmons chooses his get-out-of-jail shot, charges down the pitch to the shortish delivery and slices it over off side
looks to repeat the shot but chops it to the keeper
back of length delivery, he drops it over to the off side and thinks of a single, Boult gets to the ball and fires a throw at the non-striker's! Fletcher would have been gone by two miles
sharp bouncer! Simmons is all at sea at the moment.. looks to pull but is nowhere near.. The ball flies over the helmet
another tight single! This time to cover as Simmons calls immediately..
he is peppering them with short stuff.. another one and the batsman almost sends the leading edge all the way to the bowler, turned the bat face too soon
length delivery on the pads, the batsman misses out as it grazes his pads en route to the keeper
that's more in his hitting zone! Full and a touch wide, the batsman slices it over point but can't find the boundary as deep point cuts it off
punches this on the up through the gap at cover
slower delivery on off, the batsman dabs it to the right of point for a quick single
short and wide, Simmons looks to cut it hard but ends up edging through first slip, no one there, so it's an easy boundary
fuller and slower on off, he looks to sneak a single through off but can't beat Baz at point
back of length, another tight single to point.. This time Baz takes down the stumps but they seem to have made it fine
another glide to third-man, the singles keep coming
beautifully bowled! He did something with the wrist there, Anderson.. Squared up the batsman with this fuller delivery. Luckily for Fletcher, the edge flies safely through the vacant slip region
oh this is super smart running.. A dab to vacant midwicket region brings two as Anderson has to run around and do the clean up job
back of length outside off, the batsman chops it fine through off and picks a single to third man
goes full and wide, Simmons just leans into it and drives it to deep cover for a  single
ugly flat-batted swat at this short of length delivery, still no timing as he manages to slice past the bowler for a single.. Barely makes to the edge of the circle
shorter delivery now, it has a kind of spongy bounce on that one, the batsman sways out of line
comes down the pitch and gets a slower bounces, Fletches pulls it to deep backward square leg in a controlled manner and picks up a couple
how did he manage that! It was a low full toss on the pads and Fletcher, looking to flick, closes the bat face too early.. But the leading edge still goes towards deep square leg
he has been trying this shot all morning, it finally comes off. He comes down the track and flat-bats it with violence through midwicket.. no stopping tht
a leg-cutter this time, grips the surface a touch too. Simmons read that but cuts it straight to point
makes a lot of room to power this over cover, but gets a thick outside edge that lands safely between the third man and backward point

this has been flicked with a lot of timing over fine-leg! He moves well to the off side, Anderson saw that and aimed at the leg stump, but Simmons is smart at the job, gets his bat on that and sends it flying.. Has he missed.. woof
looks to clip it to the leg side but gets a leading edge towards point
looks to cut a ball that is not short enough, he is beaten as the ball slides under the bat
caressed! Stylishly driven through extra cover! No movement of the feet but he leant on it properly and he got all the timing behind it as well
this would have been another run out! the batsman takes off after chopping this to Watling at short third man, but I am not sure where he was heading.. He had given up completely, but Watling misses
tossed up outside off, the batsman drives it to long off for a single
flighted again and it drifts on to the pads, Simmons drives it to long off for a single
flatter this time! The batsman looks to clip it to leg side but gets a leading edge to cover
gets a lot of turn on this one, the batsman was making room and has to reach out to push it to cover

he is caught at the boundary! So calmly taken by Anderson at the edge.. We have seen these second-attempt-lobbed-catches so many times that it all seems too routine now.. He catches it, falls out of the boundary, but he remembers to lob it in.. calmly walks in and completes the catch..Simmons was looking to slog it to the stands
flatter and quicker, turns a touch in on the batsman, Bravo pushes it to cover
tossed up on off, nudged to square leg
Baz runs in from midwicket and lets this one slide under his hands.. gives away a single
he stays in the crease and tucks it to midwicket for an easy single
shuffles across the crease and pushes the flatter delivery to deep midwicket
fires it full on the leg stump line and Bravo misses his paddle shot, it's called a wide as the keeper is not able to stop that
fuller on off, pushed to midwicket for a single

flatter and shorter outside off, the batsman cuts it behind point and calls for a couple.. He could be in trouble as the throw from the deep is accurate.. The umpire is not even checking for that.. And isn't he right? Must be on specsavers
bowls a low full toss that is driven to deep cover for  a single

dropped by Neesham! Sodhi almost had his third wicket of T20s.. Bravo looks to slog this, only manages a huge top edge that goes 35000ft high, comes down at mid-off where Neesham drops a sitter.. He called early and chased everyone away..
tossed up and a low full toss, clipped to deep midwicket for a single
now he gets the value for his shot! Takes a short step down and powers the flighted delivery straight down the ground
Bravo is in no mood to enjoy the environs, he gets a full delivery and appropriately drives it over deep midwicket.. Yes, drives.. not a sweep, not a pull..
stays in the crease and defends it to midwicket. KW runs around and does his own fielding
slogs across the line but finds the deep midwicket
the captain gets a wicket! Bravo moves away to the leg side, gets a quickish delivery, looks to flay it through covers but makes no connection.. That drop has just cost 10 runs..
flatter delivery, the batsman can only push it back to the bowler
he clips this to the vacant midwicket region for an easy single
flatter delivery, this one is pushed to deep midwicket for a single
he stays in the crease and chops the length delivery to short third man for a single
fires in a yorker and Pollard loses his footing trying to flick that, it hits him flush on the pads
short of length delivery, on the body, Polly tickles it to fine leg for a single
slower delivery on the stumps but Fletcher spotted it early, just goes through with the drive and sends it way over long off
loud shout for lbw as the batsman gets rapped in front! But it hit him outside the line of off, stayed low though
picks up a single to Sodhi at short third man
he gets a thick outside edge that just evades a flying short third man! Fletcher was looking to get to his fifty with a mighty slog, he is very lucky that it just beats the fielder
he wanted to send this to the orbit but had to check that shot because this was a superbly disguised slower ball, he gets beaten
now he charges out and clobbers the length ball through midwicket, two fielders in the deep but this one scuttles to the wide long-on boundary
the bowler responds with a yorker, and Pollard has smartly chopped it fine on the offside.. With third man up, not a smart ball
short delivery this time, the batsman fails to get it away as he finds short fine leg with it
he dabs this to third man for a single
he gets to his second fifty in two matches with a quiet dab to cover! Quietly done..
gets into an awkward position with the pull shot but manages a single to deep square leg
looks to clobber this down the wicket but is beaten as this slower bounces comes even slower off the surface
fires a good yorker that the batsman digs out but can't hit it away for runs
looks for the slower ball but it's a low full toss, Fletcher misses out as he hits this straight to deep midwicket
another short ball, another poorly-executed pull shot.. But Polly would thank his stars for the poor timing there as this lands well short of deep midwicket. God bless the edge
he looks to throw his bat again but gets beaten by the slower ball

quick short ball! This is a mighty well taken HOKEY POKEY! Polly gets a taste of his own medicine! The batsman pulled this one fine, Boult, running backwards from deep midwicket takes a one-hander, off his left-hand.. but he is falling backwards.. He doesn't go against the nature.. Lobs the ball back in.. falls behind the boundary, then comes back and dives in to complete the catch.. what a stinger!
Fletcher is playing his own game, gets a length ball and calmly powers it over long off with a mighty swing
another slower ball, another move-your-front-leg-out slap over mid-on, but this is straight to long on now
he is beaten by this slower ball! And guess where it has gone.. All the way to the sight screen.. that's a long boundary.. 73 meters.. and this has gone some 10 meters ahead
you don't mess with the Sammy! He gets a short ball, he plays a double-handed forehand to the deep midwicket boundary
short and wide, it's raining runs from both ends.. Fletcher clobbers it through backward point.. asking to be hit
a bolt from Boult! Fires a full delivery on the pads and Fletcher falls over, loses his leg stump.. Wonder why he didn't try that first up
length delivery on off, the batsman plunders this to long on
he doesn't time this one and it doesn't hit the meat of the bat either! Boult gets his second as Sammy looks for a six but only gets it to long-on as this hits his bat high
too full and too wide, easy for Russell as he just slices it through the gap at point..
length delivery and way down the leg side..
fuller delivery outside off, the batsman pushes it calmly to long on for a single
manages to punch the low full toss only as far as long off
short ball from round the stumps, the batsman pulls it to fine leg
bowls a wide yorker and Russell drives it firmly to deep cover
he moves his front leg out and looks to fire this over wide long-on, but only manages to hit the low full toss down to the fielder at long on
slower yorker outside off, the batsman digs it out straight down the ground and calls early for the second
wide yorker gone wrong! This is a low full toss and Russell gets the space to get under it and smash it over extra cover
